comments.commentBody:
Or a change in law to bar their kids from public schools.

As to places like Disneyland where the current epidemic of a particularly long-lived-on-surfaces strain became public it will be up to them to require proof of vaccination before people enter the amusement park, or they will suffer the consequence of being sued by the customer for maintaining an unsafe premises..
After reading the colossally uninformed commenta from the anti-vaxxers here, I feel confident in saying that it will take widespread deaths to get these nitwits to vaccinate their kids.

You do have the right to refuse to have yourself and your children vaccinated. And schools have the right to prevent you and your children from putting others at risk due to your poor medical decisions.

If you read the article, it addresses other "medically fragile" children who are placed in highly vaccinated classrooms, so they don't see, to be ranking leukemia over other frailties. If your child had a true allergic reaction or some other legitimate medical issue that compromises his immune system, I would think you would demand that the other kids be vaccinated.

Why should your "rights to be independent human beings" put others at risk of serious diseases that are preventable? Do others not have a right to the herd immunity that those who refuse to vaccinate are jeopardizing?
And that Hesheys ad with Jason Alexander!
And the oh-so-naive "Be Kind" (unseen: "Rewind") sign in the video rental shop.
Anon, you have made the most perfect case for vaccination. Thank you.

Nope, the comparison to abortion is completely a red herring. Vaccination (subject to *medical* exceptions only) is a matter of public health, in that the safety of the population at large overrides any individual's rights here. You may consider it the price you pay to live in our civilization.

Feeling like your rights are too impinged upon? Well, there's still quite a bit of wilderness out there; don't the the door hit you on the way out.
You seem to have forgotten the lesson that Obama has already proved; that there are a lot of voters who hear what they want to hear and don't listen very well to what people actually say.

Just curious: in what year did "the bombing of the US Marine Corps Barracks building in Beirut" occur? Was it before Israel invaded Lebanon, or was it after? (Hint: a year after.) Did the US support Israel when Israel invaded Lebanon? Were any US soldiers killed in Lebanon BEFORE Israel invaded Lebanon and the US supported Israel?

actually Gov Brown is a health food, natural purist nut and is a supposed Buddhist... as i understand it. He lived communally in a Zen Buddhist house prior to becoming governor.. so i think he must have overexposed himself to the wing nuts from another dimension for him to add the religious exemption clause. Can't see any other reason for his foolish action.
Closed, not open, controlling, easily threatened. Shallow bodies shake easily.

What ever happened to the idea of our social responsibility to the community at large?  The reason that some parents have the luxury of not vaccinating their children is that the rest of us have assumed the risks (very small) of vaccinating our children, not just to protect them, but to help eradicate disease and protect society as a whole.  Deep down, most parents who don't vaccinate their children are reassured that terrible diseases probably won't make a huge comeback because the rest of us are vaccinating our kids.  So the threat right now is to the vulnerable who can't be vaccinated, like Rhett Krawitt.

I am saddened to read that you think a healthy immune system makes one impervious to "any disease on the planet." It does not. God forbid your child contracts such a disease. Those who have experienced such illness in children they refused to vaccinate report the devastating guilt they feel. Please. Reconsider.

There's a simple fix to this problem for public employees who don't want to be forced to fully perform their jobs pursuant to the laws of their state.

Quit. Better yet, someone fire them. Borrow a page from Reagan's playbook and give them a deadline to comply and fulfill the duties of their jobs, not just the parts they like, and if they fail...fire them.

Problem solved.
Thank you, Katie!

When religious zealots can prove to me that God exists, then I'll ever bother to entertain the notion that their religious beliefs trump the rights of all others whom don't conform to their beliefs.  Until then, kindly go away.
Like I said, they have a death wish.

Sorry but Mayer's a joke as CEO. If it weren't for Jerry Yang's prescient investment, she wouldn't have a roof over her head as Yahoo would be bankrupt. But the Alibaba connection gave her a cart blanche ability to spend to her heart's content since coming on as CEO - and the results have been zilch. The company's legacy business remains that - legacy. No growth, just shrinkage. It's been a strikingly feckless performance. She does not deserve to continue as chief executive and there is no compelling business reason why Yahoo ought to continue as an independent company. Either break it up and sell the pieces or bring in an acquirer.

There's plenty of time for Elizabeth Warren to run for President in 2024, after Hillary Clinton finished her term of office. Whatever else the GOP might believe about Warren, she's very smart and so is Clinton, so there's zero chance they'll engage in the kind of nomination knife-fight the Republicans are fantasizing about.

By contrast, there's a strong chance the Republicans will have that kind of nomination fight themselves, giving us all some comic relief....

“I obviously have to balance the responsibility to control communicable disease with everybody’s right to freedom, and the line right now would basically be if there’s a case in this school,” Dr. Willis said. "

"Obviously", this man is a blithering idiot, and is not qualified to be a public health officer. If the threshold for vaccination were whether or not there were a case in the school, we should eliminate any vaccination requirement for polio, MMR, DPT, meningitis, H. flu, etc. since there are currently no cases of those diseases in that school. This statement alone should be grounds for dismissal from his post.
Despite being a lifelong progressive, I sometimes feel that California sometimes goes too far in pandering to the many affluent and narcissistic people who inhabit it.
As in OMG?
Oh my.

ebmem -- marriage law has never been about the protection of women and children. (It's a recent development, for example, that a man has not been legally allowed to beat his wife or his children.) It's historically been about the inheritance of property, which is an issue no different for gay couples or lesbian couples than it is for heterosexual couples..

Therefore, the "family law consequences" are no different for gay families or lesbian families than they are for heterosexual families (even classifying families that way sounds ridiculous -- a family is a family).

As far as judges and their "prejudices" -- ruling in favor of the upholding of rights hardly constitutes being "prejudiced." In fact, just the opposite.

Marraige is a state-sanctioned legal right, so none of your arguments stand. Yes, in addition to the legal right, you can have a religious union, but that is a separate matter and no one is making churches marry same sex couples.
"seems" is the only operative word in your comment, Eugene.

It seems to me that those favoring same sex marriage are mistaken in their position and the anti same sex marriage people are correct.

Marriage is a religious rite; therefore the state has no business in regulating marriage at all.

If it were up to me, I would amend all state and federal laws that discuss marriage or divorce to refer to civil unions. Precisely because marriage is a religious rite, the government may not regulate it, or have anything to do with it. Thus, same sex or different sex partners may enjoy civil unions under government regulation. No one may marry under government auspices.

No one has ever been able to predict Mother Natures next move with certainty. And no one ought to be ridiculed for playing it safe rather than being responsible  for unnecessary deaths. People need to have a certain fear/respect for Mother Nature.  Don't try to second guess her. Business can always restart. But a lost life is forever gone.

Vaccines actually are for those with a healthy immune system as they need the immune system to generate a healthy reponse.  You must have read about kids who cannot get vaccinated because their systems were "too weak."
Evidence US 'created ISIS?'

You could also assume Iran might wish to protect the Shi'ite population of Palestine, currently being raped by the Israelis, in a dozen ways.  If there is something wrong with a country showing such interest, explain why we (US) do it for Israel.  Meantime, it helps to understand Palestine --- prior to the time much of its best territory was taken by the more aggressive, modern, and war-trained East Europeans at the beginning of the 20th century.
